bibl.title: Despatch from William H. Heard to Edwin F. Uhl, June 3, 1895
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate General of United States, Monrovia, Liberia, June 3rd, 1895.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D. JUL 5 1895 DEPT OF STATE
To Mayor of Minneapolis July 7, 1895 Nests July 23, '95

div1.p: William H. Heard, to the Department of State.
In account with J. C. Todd, Expressage and Removing,
114 THIRD STREET SOUTH. All Orders left with me will Receive Prompt and Careful Attention. Leave Orders at Ball & Naylor's.
Consulate General of United States, Monrovia, Liberia, June 3rd 1895.
Hon. Edwin F. Uhle, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to inform you that one Julius C Todd and his wife both citizens of the United States and of Minneapolis, MN, died at Clay Ashland Liberia Jany 1894 leaving five penniless orphans, one has since died, leaving four, whose ages range from two to twelve years. Mr Todd had property in Minneapolis Min Messers Yale & co "Real Estate and Insurance Dealers" were his Agent.

Mr. B. Y. Payne Vice Consul wrote them in Sept 1894 but they have not replied. A Guardian should be appointed to look after these children. Mrs. M. A. Williams and M. A. Foster of this city and Hon. L. C. Lomax of Clay Ashland Liberia have cared for the children Gratis to the present. Will your honor call the attention of the authorities in Minneapolis Min, to this matter? I send Mr. Todd's Seal address and business Card.
I am obediently William H. Heard Minister Resident and Con. General
I Enclosure Mr. Todd's Seal Business Card
